intro: Roupala paruensis, commonly known as the Paruensis tree, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is smooth and grayish, while its wood is valued for its durability and workability. Roupala paruensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
